content.headline: HANDS

image.alt: A GIF of my game, HANDS. Rock Paper Scissors but weird.

content.text:
This Game Project was made in Game Maker 2, as a personal project in my free time, started in 2021.

For Hands, I started out with 2 Ideas.
I have a deep respect for games simple rule sets, so I wanted to explore that.
Additionally, I dislike making my own assets, but I'm never content with 3rd party assets.
So I wanted to test how far I could make it with just 1ish sprite.

God is dead, and all that's left is his corpse, angels and some fading souls.
You have the chance to ascend to godhood to take the empty throne, but thy must take the trial of hands.

Borrowing from Judaist beliefs, the space of existence is inside god, who is dead.
So I wanted to make every bit of the game feel as weird as possible.
In many design decisions, I oriented my design around the feeling you would get when viewing a living organism from the inside.
Which everything being in motion constantly and reacting to your actions with more writhing, and pulsing.

Gameplay wise, early on I thought about basic rock paper scissors with some minor modification. This proved, far more difficult, than imagined. Altering one thing would throw out the balance of another.

At the moment, the gameplay is still in early stages.
All rules are configurable, so one can create their own game within limitations.
After some more work, I would publish this version.
With the intent to hopefully find the best version of the rules with the feedback.

Early on, I tried to find ways to build the game without using text, which wasn't feasible.
I may revisit this idea. I would love to make the game so otherworldly that every second with it feels alienating. And forgoing a normalcy such as text would certainly work towards this alienation.

After telling some of my colleagues about the game, one noted how much it sounded like a simple fighting game.
I was surprised by that comparison, but they were completely right.
Owing to me having absolutely no experience with fighting games, I didn't see the obvious comparison.

content.headline: Phaser Game

image.alt: A GIF of a Phaser Game Projekts Level Editor.

content.text:
This project was started as for my university class “Medien Informatik 2” in my second semester of University.

We were assigned to make a small game, in a group, using the Phaser HTML5 game engine for JavaScript, while preparing documentation and applying learned information from the university lectures.

Gameplay wise, the player would control a drone which could only grapple along walls and jump off them.
The play has to navigate through a large map and beat 3-5 bosses, in any order, to beat the game.
Inspired by the Game Titan Souls, these bosses would function like an action puzzle box, and both the player and the boss would die in one hit.
Death would only be a minor setback of being thrown out of the boos arena and the boss resetting.
The player had to learn the behaviour of a boss, while trying to survive and position themselves in a way they could beat the boss, while managing their own survival.

The game was a combination of many excellent design choices from inspiring works across mediums.

The two aspects I was excited to explore most was firstly, to give the game a sci-fi, industrial + jungle theme but to completely avoid showing the jungle part.

The Japanese animation film Akira from 1991 has a similar theme for the city the film takes place in, but the jungle aspect is only suggested by the music and the portrayed city having many aspects in common that we associate with a jungle ecosystem.
The metropolis being crowded, loud and dense, not a plant in sight, and jet together with the tribal music the subconscious association with a thick jungle is immediately apparent.

Second, we wanted to try to recreate the timeless intrigue, a vast and purposefully designed world like the map of Shadow of the Colossus.
Where space and exploration are removed from the usual player reward process and have meaning in themselves.

They were some management mistakes on the universities side this semester, so the time we had for all the projects was not appropriate.
Resulting in a lot of crunch on our side and changes in deadlines and evaluation criteria on theirs.

In the end we had a basic level editor, some base mechanics and some good visual assets.
I felt we hadn't done the vision of the project justice, so I would like to continue the development.
But other courses and some earned holiday has priority, if my schedule allows it I would like to complete attest the tutorial section of the game.

content.headline: Sport Ort

image.alt:
The Sport Ort Website's Main Landing Page.
The Map shows the German city Bremen and all the Sporting locations entered into the system.

content.text:
Translates from German into English as “Sport Place”.

The website was created for a university assignment in which we should create any sort of website that would prove useful for Refugees living in Bremen, Germany.

My Group decided to build a Website that would assist someone in finding a sporting location, with a focus on free and open offers.
Data management was done with Google Sheets, in which all locations were registered.
Entries would show a location's availability, sport, location and more.

We used the Google Maps API together with some custom HTML, CSS and JS.
